skill.name: Code Quality Skill
skill.description: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.summary: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only file that describes code quality workflows. It contains no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The skill only documents how to use external tools (Black, Ruff, BasedPyright, pre-commit) but does not execute them.

content.value_statement: Code quality tools are scattered and hard to remember. This skill provides a unified reference for formatting, linting, and type checking Python projects with Black, Ruff, and BasedPyright.
actual_capabilities: Format Python code with Black and Ruff
Run Ruff linting checks with auto-fix
limitations: Requires project to have pre-commit configuration
Type checking requires BasedPyright in dependencies
Does not modify code automatically (read-only validation)

use_cases.title: Quick code validation
use_cases.description: Run all quality checks before committing code to catch issues early.

use_cases.title: CI pipeline integration
use_cases.description: Use commands in CI/CD pipelines to enforce code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Consistent review standards
use_cases.description: Apply uniform formatting and linting rules across all contributed code.

best_practices: Run linting before committing to catch issues early
Use BasedPyright strict mode for comprehensive type checking
Configure pre-commit hooks to run quality checks automatically
anti_patterns: Skipping linting checks to save time
Using bare except clauses that bypass Ruff BLE rules

faq.question: What Python tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Black and Ruff for formatting, Ruff for linting, BasedPyright for type checking, and pre-commit for hook validation.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: Formatting and some linting fixes can modify code. Use --fix flag with Ruff to apply auto-fixes. Type checking is read-only.

faq.question: What is PyStrict mode in Ruff?
faq.answer: PyStrict enables strict rules including blind except detection, error message standards, and no debugger statements.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other formatters?
faq.answer: This skill documents Black and Ruff. Other formatters like isort can be added via pre-commit configuration.

faq.question: How do I skip certain linting rules?
faq.answer: Add noqa comments to specific lines or configure per-file ignores in pyproject.toml.

faq.question: What is the difference between Ruff and BasedPyright?
faq.answer: Ruff checks code style and quality rules. BasedPyright performs static type analysis for type safety.
